        private void placeBall()
        method: placeBall(); Places the ball in the center of the screen. Called at the start and every time the players loses the ball. Waits for player to click before proceeding.

      • checkForLastBrick

        private void checkForLastBrick()
        method: checkForLastBrick(); The runawayBrick feature is activated here. Brick scores are assigned in the range [NBRICK_COLORS + 1; 2 * NBRICK_COLORS]. When there are two bricks remaining the score can at max be (maxScore - 2 * (NBRICK_COLORS + 1).

      • getBrickColorIndex

        private int getBrickColorIndex(java.awt.Color brickColor)
        method: getBrickColorIndex(); Returns the index of where the color is in the BRICK_COLORS array.
        Parameters:
        brickColor - : The color of the brick
        Returns:
        index of the color

      • placeScoreBoard

        private void placeScoreBoard()
        method: placeScoreBoard(); Adds the scoreboard to the screen.

      • setTimer

        private void setTimer()
        method: setTimer(); Adds a timer to the lower left part of the screen. Keeps track of how long the game has been going.

      • updateTimer

        private void updateTimer()
        method: updateTimer(); Updates the game timer.

      • startGame

        private boolean startGame()
        method: startGame(); Starts the game, keeps track of the player's lives and score.
        Returns:
        boolean representing the outcome of the game : true -> win

      • checkBorderCol

        private void checkBorderCol(double x,
                            double y)
        method: checkBorderCol() Checks if any border collisions have occurred and rebounds the ball accordingly (or decrements lives if the crossed border is the bottom one).
        Parameters:
        x, - y : current position of the ball

      • checkObjCol

        private void checkObjCol(double x,
                         double y)
        method: checkObjCol(); Checks for collisions with objects. If collision was with a brick, it increases the score and removes the brick. The rebound happens differently for paddle/bricks.
        Parameters:
        x, - y : current position of the ball

      • checkCollider

        private int checkCollider(double x,
                          double y)
        method: checkCollider(); Sets colObject to reference whatever the ball collided with (if at all). Also returns the angle at which that object touched the balls circumference (approximate).
        Parameters:
        x, - y : current position of the ball
        Returns:
        collision angle (approximated) or -1 if no collision

      • findInterval

        private int findInterval(double angle)
        method: findInterval(); Returns the multiple of INTERVAL_SIZE that is closest to the input.
        Parameters:
        angle - : The angle that's being approximated
        Returns:
        The approximated angle as an int

      • reboundPaddle

        private void reboundPaddle(double x,
                           double y)
        method: reboundPaddle(); This method bounces the ball, but it's only called if the paddle was hit.
        Parameters:
        x, - y : current position of the ball

      • fancyRebound

        private void fancyRebound(double x,
                          double y)
        method: fancyRebound(); This method changes the ball's horizontal speed, based on where it hit the paddle and how fast the paddle was moving.
        Parameters:
        x, - y : current position of the ball

      • cornerRebound

        private void cornerRebound(double margin,
                           int direction)
        method: cornerRebound(); This method changes the horizontal speed based on where it hit the paddle's corner.
        Parameters:
        margin - : |(x of ball) - (x of paddle)|
        direction - : direction of the ball's horizontal velocity

      • speedRebound

        private void speedRebound()
        method: speedRebound() Changes the balls horizontal velocity according to what the paddle's speed was when it hit.

      • reboundBrick

        private void reboundBrick(int angleOfCollision)
        method: reboundBrick(); Changes the balls velocity according to what side of the ball was hit. Generally it reverses the vertical velocity if the collision was from the top/bottom, otherwise it reverses the horizontal velocity.
        Parameters:
        angleOfCollision - (approximate)

      • reboundRunawayBrick

        private void reboundRunawayBrick(int angleOfCollision)
        method: reboundRunawayBrick(); A version of the reboundBrick() for the final brick, which also triggers the animation thread and keeps track of the brick's health points.
        Parameters:
        angleOfCollision - : angle at which the ball hit the brick

      • clearGame

        private void clearGame()
        method: clearGame(); Clears all objects from the screen.

      • endAllThreads

        private void endAllThreads()
        method: endAllThreads(); Tells all the remaining threads to finish executing.

        method: gameOver(); Displays the appropriate message and records the score.
        Parameters:
        success - : the outcome of the game. true -> win

                            java.io.File file,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines,
                            java.lang.String userName)
        method: addNewScore(); Tries to add the new score in between already existing elements of the list. returns false if unsuccessful.
        Parameters:
        data - : The data that's being added
        file - : The file the data's being added to
        lines - : The List containing the data file's lines
        userName - : The user's chosen alias for the given score
        Returns:

      • getRunawayBrick

        private Brick getRunawayBrick()
        method: getRunawayBrick(); Checks the all the locations where the bricks where placed to find the last remaining brick.
        Returns:
        a reference to a Brick object (The last brick); null if there is no such brick.

      • runawayBrick

        private void runawayBrick()
        method: runawayBrick() Moves the last brick horizontally at a fixed speed. The brick will sometimes change directions at random.
